API_Description: Sends an email message with an attachment using the default email client.
API_Description_Reason: The method name 'mailMsgWithAttachment' suggests that it is used to send an email message with an attachment. This is a common functionality in applications that interact with email clients.
Returns: A boolean indicating whether the email was successfully sent.
Returns_Reason: Typically, methods that perform an action like sending an email return a boolean to indicate success or failure.

bUI.description: A boolean indicating whether to display the email client user interface.
bUI.description_reason: The parameter name 'bUI' suggests it controls the visibility of the user interface, a common option in email-sending functions.
bUI.type_reason: The 'b' prefix in 'bUI' indicates a boolean type, which is a common naming convention.

cTo.description: The email address of the primary recipient.
cTo.description_reason: The parameter name 'cTo' is a standard naming convention for specifying the recipient's email address.
cTo.type_reason: Email addresses are typically represented as strings.

cCc.description: The email address of the carbon copy recipient.
cCc.description_reason: The parameter name 'cCc' follows the standard email terminology for carbon copy recipients.
cCc.type_reason: Email addresses are typically represented as strings.

cBcc.description: The email address of the blind carbon copy recipient.
cBcc.description_reason: The parameter name 'cBcc' follows the standard email terminology for blind carbon copy recipients.
cBcc.type_reason: Email addresses are typically represented as strings.

cSubject.description: The subject line of the email.
cSubject.description_reason: The parameter name 'cSubject' clearly indicates it is used for the email's subject line.
cSubject.type_reason: Subject lines are typically represented as strings.

cMsg.description: The body content of the email message.
cMsg.description_reason: The parameter name 'cMsg' suggests it is used for the message content of the email.
cMsg.type_reason: Email message bodies are typically represented as strings.

cAttachment.description: The file path of the attachment to include in the email.
cAttachment.description_reason: The parameter name 'cAttachment' indicates it is used to specify the file to attach to the email.
cAttachment.type_reason: File paths are typically represented as strings.

cFS.description: A string representing the file system or format specifics for the attachment.
cFS.description_reason: The parameter name 'cFS' suggests it relates to file system or format specifics, which might be necessary for handling attachments.
cFS.type_reason: File system or format specifics are typically represented as strings.
